intro: Plectaneia tsaratanensis, commonly known as the Madagascar milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Plectaneia tsaratanensis is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Madagascar, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats.
